definition: a drum-shaped rattle (used by peddlers or as a toy)/rattle-drum
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

sentences.chinese: 来吧拨浪鼓它们的制造者。

sentences.english: Out of the corner of my eye, I saw a baby playing with rattles on my mother’s bed.
sentences.chinese: 我眼角余光看到一个小孩在妈妈的床上玩拨浪鼓。

sentences.english: The baby threw down its rattle.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿把他的拨浪鼓扔掉了。

sentences.english: Rattle is widely distributed throughout the world, five continents.
sentences.chinese: 拨浪鼓在世界各地分布很广，五大洲都有。

sentences.english: Early toy rattle is a musical instrument instead.
sentences.chinese: 早期的拨浪鼓是乐器而非玩具。

sentences.english: And if you listen closely, you can hear the tinkle of the rattle as you move.
sentences.chinese: 如果你侧耳聆听，你会听见拨浪鼓摇动时的叮当声。

sentences.english: I ran with the rattle to the living room, and showed everyone.
sentences.chinese: 我拿著拨浪鼓跑回起居室，把它拿给大家看。

sentences.english: The baby, dressed in a flowery jumpsuit, waved her rattle .
sentences.chinese: 宝宝穿着印花的连身衣，挥动着她手中的拨浪鼓。

sentences.english: As I got closer to it, I noticed it was a little rattle, the kind little babies had.
sentences.chinese: 我走近一看，发现是一个小婴儿用的拨浪鼓。

definition: seems as if/rather like/Taiwan pr. [si4 de5]
bell made of copper or bronze
to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
to sift chaff/(fig.) to shake all over
to make a scene/to raise hell
hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
